model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I met this guy at work who's wife is an athletic trainer, they asked me to pass their info on to you to discuss possible internships!

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Speaker B is a college student attending FDU, studying sports medicine and playing soccer. They are currently looking for an internship in the sports medicine field and are hoping to join the college sports team next fall. Speaker B is the only child of a kind mother and is considering creative ways to stand out in the competitive job market.

Relationship Description:
Speaker B and Speaker A have a friendly and supportive relationship. Speaker A encourages Speaker B to keep confidence in themselves, offers advice on making connections with doctors through surfing, and discusses the job market in the medical field with Speaker B.

Event Description:
Events shared by Speaker B and Speaker A include discussions about Speaker B's internship search, their interest in sports medicine, and their plan to join the college sports team. Speaker A shares tips from their neighbor John with Speaker B and suggests surfing as a way to make connections with doctors. Speaker A also mentions their past surfing experiences and hopes to get back into surfing. Speaker B's friends are experienced surfers and pros, and Speaker B is training to build stamina and sharpen reflexes for soccer. Speaker B is lucky to have supportive professors writing letters for their internship. Speaker B is considering pretending to get hurt surfing to connect with a doctor, and Speaker A encourages them to get creative and continue surfing.
